text: Sara Maria Danius (5 April 1962 – 12 October 2019) was a Swedish scholar of literature, aesthetics , and a former member of the Nobel Prize in Literature committee. Danius was professor of aesthetics at Södertörn University, docent of literature at Uppsala University and professor in literary science at Stockholm University. Danius was a member of the Swedish Academy and its first female permanent secretary. She was one of the central figures in the 2018 controversies , resulting in the cancellation of the Nobel Prize in Literature that year and the following restructuring of the academy. She was born in Täby. Danius died on 12 October 2019, aged 57, after having suffered from breast cancer for several years.
